contextId.occurrenceNote: To fold the hands is a gesture of laziness and is another way of saying that the person refuses to work. Alternate translation: "The fool refuses to work" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-parallelism]])
contextId.glQuote: The fool folds his hands and does not work

contextId.occurrenceNote: Wearing white clothes and anointing one's head with oil were both signs of gladness and celebration. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: Let your clothes be always white and your head anointed with oil
